83
84#if (AM_HAL_PWRCTL_SET_CORELDO_MEMLDO_IN_PARALLEL == 1)
85#error AM_HAL_PWRCTL_SET_CORELDO_MEMLDO_IN_PARALLEL must be set to 0 for Apollo330P.
86#endif

168#define BUCK_LP_TEMP_THRESHOLD 50.0f
169#define VDDC_VDDF_TEMPCO_THRESHOLD 35.0f
170#define TEMP_HYSTERESIS 2.0f
171#define LOW_LIMIT -273.0f
172#define HIGH_LIMIT 1000.0f
173#define VDDC_VDDF_TEMPCO_THRESHOLD_LOW -20.0f
174#define VDDC_VDDF_TEMPCO_THRESHOLD_MID 0.0f
175#define VDDC_VDDF_TEMPCO_THRESHOLD_HIGH 50.0f

177//
180//
181#define AM_HAL_PWRCTRL_PERF_SWITCH_WAIT_US 20
182
183//
188//
189// #define AM_HAL_STALL_CPU_HPWAKE 0
190
191//
196//
197#define vddc_to_vddclv_and_vdds_to_vddf_short(bShort) \
198do \
199{ \
200 if (bShort) \
201 { \
202 MCUCTRL->PWRSW1_b.SHORTVDDCVDDCLVORVAL = 1; \
203 MCUCTRL->PWRSW1_b.SHORTVDDCVDDCLVOREN = 1; \
204 MCUCTRL->PWRSW1_b.SHORTVDDFVDDSORVAL = 1; \
205 MCUCTRL->PWRSW1_b.SHORTVDDFVDDSOREN = 1; \
206 } \
207 else \
208 { \
209 MCUCTRL->PWRSW1_b.SHORTVDDCVDDCLVORVAL = 0; \
210 MCUCTRL->PWRSW1_b.SHORTVDDCVDDCLVOREN = 0; \
211 MCUCTRL->PWRSW1_b.SHORTVDDFVDDSORVAL = 0; \
212 MCUCTRL->PWRSW1_b.SHORTVDDFVDDSOREN = 0; \
213 } \
214} while (0);

230} am_hal_pwrctrl_mcu_mode_e;

496//*****************************************************************************
497//
499//
500//*****************************************************************************
501typedef struct
502{
503 uint32_t ui32INFO1GlobalValid;
504
505 uint32_t ui32SBLVer0; // 00 Apollo330P MRAM
506 uint32_t ui32SBLVer1; // 04 Apollo330P MRAM
507
508 uint32_t ui32MAINPTR; // 10
509 uint32_t ui32SBLOTA; // 18 Apollo330P
510
511 uint32_t ui32SOCID0; // 20 OTP
512 uint32_t ui32SOCID1; // 24 OTP
513 uint32_t ui32SOCID2; // 28 OTP
514 uint32_t ui32SOCID3; // 2C OTP
515 uint32_t ui32SOCID4; // 30 OTP
516 uint32_t ui32SOCID5; // 34 OTP
517 uint32_t ui32SOCID6; // 38 OTP
518 uint32_t ui32SOCID7; // 3C OTP
519
520 uint32_t ui32TEMP_CAL_ATE; // 00
521 uint32_t ui32TEMP_CAL_MEASURED; // 04
522 uint32_t ui32TEMP_CAL_ADC_OFFSET; // 08
523 uint32_t ui32ADC_GAIN_ERR; // 28
524 uint32_t ui32ADC_OFFSET_ERR; // 2C
525
526 uint32_t ui32AUDADC_A0_LG_OFFSET; // 40
527 uint32_t ui32AUDADC_A0_HG_SLOPE; // 44
528 uint32_t ui32AUDADC_A0_HG_INTERCEPT; // 48
529 uint32_t ui32AUDADC_A1_LG_OFFSET; // 4C
530 uint32_t ui32AUDADC_A1_HG_SLOPE; // 50
531 uint32_t ui32AUDADC_A1_HG_INTERCEPT; // 54
532 uint32_t ui32AUDADC_B0_LG_OFFSET; // 58
533 uint32_t ui32AUDADC_B0_HG_SLOPE; // 5C
534 uint32_t ui32AUDADC_B0_HG_INTERCEPT; // 60
535 uint32_t ui32AUDADC_B1_LG_OFFSET; // 64
536 uint32_t ui32AUDADC_B1_HG_SLOPE; // 68
537 uint32_t ui32AUDADC_B1_HG_INTERCEPT; // 6C
538} am_hal_pwrctrl_info1_regs_t;
539
540#define INFO1DATAENTRIES (sizeof(am_hal_pwrctrl_info1_regs_t) / 4)

am_hal_pwrctrl_periph_enabled
uint32_t am_hal_pwrctrl_periph_enabled(am_hal_pwrctrl_periph_e ePeripheral, bool *bEnabled)
Determine whether a peripheral is currently enabled.
Definition am_hal_pwrctrl.c:1950
am_hal_pwrctrl_sram_config
